title: Authors and Citation
text: Meng Xu. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Xu M (2025). thisplot: Utility Functions Plotting. R package version 0.1.0, https://mengxu98.github.io/thisplot/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {thisplot: Utility Functions for Plotting},   author = {Meng Xu},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://mengxu98.github.io/thisplot/}, }

title: Utility Functions for Plotting
text: thisplot R package providing utility functions data visualization plotting. includes tools color manipulation (blending, conversion, palettes), plot customization (themes, grob operations, patchwork building), panel size control, data optimization plots, layout adjustments. Designed enhance workflows ggplot2, patchwork, ComplexHeatmap.

title: Utility Functions for Plotting
text: Install CRAN version: Install development version GitHub use pak:
code: install.packages("thisplot") # or if (!require("pak", quietly = TRUE)) {   install.packages("pak") } pak::pak("thisplot") if (!require("pak", quietly = TRUE)) {   install.packages("pak") } pak::pak("mengxu98/thisplot")

title: Utility Functions for Plotting
text: Please reference .

what: Blend two colors using a specified mode — Blend2Color
title: Blend two colors using a specified mode — Blend2Color
text: Blend two colors alpha channels using one several blending modes: blend, average, screen, multiply.

title: Blend two colors using a specified mode — Blend2Color
code: Blend2Color(C1, C2, mode = "blend")

title: Blend two colors using a specified mode — Blend2Color
text: C1 list containing first color RGB values alpha channel. C2 list containing second color RGB values alpha channel. mode blending mode use. One "blend", "average", "screen", "multiply". Default "blend".

title: Blend two colors using a specified mode — Blend2Color
text: list containing blended RGB values alpha channel.

what: Blend a list of colors — BlendRGBList
title: Blend a list of colors — BlendRGBList
text: Blend multiple colors alpha channels single color using specified blending mode.

title: Blend a list of colors — BlendRGBList
code: BlendRGBList(Clist, mode = "blend", RGB_BackGround = c(1, 1, 1))

title: Blend a list of colors — BlendRGBList
text: Clist list colors, color list containing RGB values alpha channel. mode blending mode use. One "blend", "average", "screen", "multiply". Default "blend". RGB_BackGround background RGB color composite . Default c(1, 1, 1) (white).

title: Blend a list of colors — BlendRGBList
text: numeric vector RGB values.

what: Convert RGBA color to RGB with background — RGBA2RGB
title: Convert RGBA color to RGB with background — RGBA2RGB
text: Convert RGBA (Red, Green, Blue, Alpha) color RGB compositing background color based alpha channel.

title: Convert RGBA color to RGB with background — RGBA2RGB
code: RGBA2RGB(RGBA, BackGround = c(1, 1, 1))

title: Convert RGBA color to RGB with background — RGBA2RGB
text: RGBA list containing RGB values alpha channel. BackGround background RGB color composite . Default c(1, 1, 1) (white).

title: Convert RGBA color to RGB with background — RGBA2RGB
text: numeric vector RGB values.

text: gtable gtable object. grob grob gtable object add. position position add grob. One "top", "bottom", "left", "right", "none". space space allocate grob. NULL, calculated automatically. clip clipping mode. Default "".

title: Add a grob to a gtable — add_grob
text: gtable object grob added.

what: Convert a color with specified alpha level — adjcolors

title: Convert a color with specified alpha level — adjcolors
text: colors Color vectors. alpha Alpha level [0,1].

title: Convert a color with specified alpha level — adjcolors
code: colors <- c("red", "blue", "green") adjcolors(colors, 0.5) #>        V1        V2        V3  #> "#FF8080" "#8080FF" "#80FF80"  ggplot2::alpha(colors, 0.5) #> [1] "#FF000080" "#0000FF80" "#00FF0080"  show_palettes(   list(     "raw" = colors,     "adjcolors" = adjcolors(colors, 0.5),     "ggplot2::alpha" = ggplot2::alpha(colors, 0.5)   ) )  #> [1] "raw"            "adjcolors"      "ggplot2::alpha"

what: Blends a list of colors using the specified blend mode — blendcolors
title: Blends a list of colors using the specified blend mode — blendcolors
text: Blends list colors using specified blend mode

title: Blends a list of colors using the specified blend mode — blendcolors
code: blendcolors(colors, mode = c("blend", "average", "screen", "multiply"))

title: Blends a list of colors using the specified blend mode — blendcolors
text: colors Color vectors. mode Blend mode. One "blend", "average", "screen", "multiply".

title: Blends a list of colors using the specified blend mode — blendcolors
code: blend <- c(   "red",   "green",   blendcolors(c("red", "green"),     mode = "blend"   ) ) average <- c(   "red",   "green",   blendcolors(c("red", "green"),     mode = "average"   ) ) screen <- c(   "red",   "green",   blendcolors(c("red", "green"),     mode = "screen"   ) ) multiply <- c(   "red",   "green",   blendcolors(c("red", "green"),     mode = "multiply"   ) ) show_palettes(   list(     "blend" = blend,     "average" = average,     "screen" = screen,     "multiply" = multiply   ) )  #> [1] "blend"    "average"  "screen"   "multiply"

title: Build a patchwork gtable — build_patchwork
text: x patchwork object. guides handle guides. Default "auto". table_rows number rows table grid. Default 18. table_cols number columns table grid. Default 15. panel_row row index panels. Default 10. panel_col column index panels. Default 8.

title: Build a patchwork gtable — build_patchwork
text: gtable object.

what: Drop unused data in the plot — drop_data
title: Drop unused data in the plot — drop_data
text: Drop unused data points ggplot patchwork object preserving plot structure. function keeps single row data unique combination used variables, can significantly reduce object size original data contains many rows displayed plot (e.g., due scale limits filtering).

title: Drop unused data in the plot — drop_data
code: drop_data(p)  # S3 method for class 'ggplot' drop_data(p)  # S3 method for class 'patchwork' drop_data(p)  # Default S3 method drop_data(p)

title: Drop unused data in the plot — drop_data
text: p ggplot object patchwork object.

title: Drop unused data in the plot — drop_data
text: ggplot patchwork object unused data points removed.

title: Drop unused data in the plot — drop_data
code: library(ggplot2) library(patchwork) p <- ggplot(   data = mtcars,   aes(x = mpg, y = wt, colour = cyl) ) +   geom_point() +   scale_x_continuous(limits = c(10, 30)) +   scale_y_continuous(limits = c(1, 6)) object.size(p) #> 368016 bytes  p_drop <- drop_data(p) object.size(p_drop) #> 362968 bytes  p / p_drop #> Warning: Removed 4 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`).

what: Get used vars in a ggplot object — get_vars
title: Get used vars in a ggplot object — get_vars
text: Get used vars ggplot object

title: Get used vars in a ggplot object — get_vars
code: get_vars(p, reverse = FALSE, verbose = TRUE)

title: Get used vars in a ggplot object — get_vars
text: p ggplot object. reverse Whether return unused vars. Default FALSE. verbose Whether print message. Default TRUE.

title: Get used vars in a ggplot object — get_vars
code: library(ggplot2) p <- ggplot(   data = mtcars,   aes(x = mpg, y = wt, colour = cyl) ) +   geom_point() get_vars(p) #> ℹ [2025-11-10 02:55:02] Vars_used: "mpg", "cyl", and "wt" #> ℹ                       vars_notused: "disp", "hp", "drat", "qsec", "vs", "am", "gear", and "carb" #> [1] "mpg" "cyl" "wt"  get_vars(p, reverse = TRUE) #> ℹ [2025-11-10 02:55:02] Vars_used: "mpg", "cyl", and "wt" #> ℹ                       vars_notused: "disp", "hp", "drat", "qsec", "vs", "am", "gear", and "carb" #> [1] "disp" "hp"   "drat" "qsec" "vs"   "am"   "gear" "carb"

title: Color palettes collected — palette_colors
text: function creates color palette given vector values.

title: Color palettes collected — palette_colors
code: palette_colors(   x,   n = 100,   palette = "Paired",   palcolor = NULL,   type = "auto",   matched = FALSE,   reverse = FALSE,   NA_keep = FALSE,   NA_color = "grey80" )

title: Color palettes collected — palette_colors
text: x vector character/factor numeric values. missing, numeric values 1:n used x. n number colors return numeric values. palette Palette name. available palette names can queried show_palettes. palcolor Custom colors used create color palette. type Type x. Can one "auto", "discrete" "continuous". default "auto", automatically detects x numeric value. matched Whether return color vector length x. Default FALSE. reverse Whether invert colors. Default FALSE. NA_keep Whether keep color assignment NA x. Default FALSE. NA_color Color assigned NA NA_keep TRUE. Default "grey80".

title: Color palettes collected — palette_colors

what: A list of palettes for use in data visualization — palette_list
title: A list of palettes for use in data visualization — palette_list
text: list palettes use data visualization

title: A list of palettes for use in data visualization — palette_list
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ if (interactive()) {   pak::pak(     c(       "stringr", "RColorBrewer", "ggsci", "Redmonder",       "rcartocolor", "nord", "viridis", "pals", "oompaBase",       "dichromat", "jaredhuling/jcolors"     )   )   library(stringr)   library(RColorBrewer)   library(ggsci)   library(Redmonder)   library(rcartocolor)   library(nord)   library(viridis)   library(pals)   library(dichromat)   library(jcolors)   brewer.pal.info <- RColorBrewer::brewer.pal.info   ggsci_db <- ggsci:::ggsci_db   redmonder.pal.info <- Redmonder::redmonder.pal.info   metacartocolors <- rcartocolor::metacartocolors   rownames(metacartocolors) <- metacartocolors$Name   nord_palettes <- nord::nord_palettes   viridis_names <- c(     "magma", "inferno", "plasma", "viridis",     "cividis", "rocket", "mako", "turbo"   )   viridis_palettes <- lapply(     stats::setNames(viridis_names, viridis_names),     function(x) viridis::viridis(100, option = x)   )   ocean_names <- names(     pals:::syspals   )[grep(     "ocean",     names(pals:::syspals)   )]   ocean_palettes <- pals:::syspals[ocean_names]   dichromat_palettes <- dichromat::colorschemes   jcolors_names <- paste0(     "jcolors-",     c(       "default", "pal2", "pal3", "pal4", "pal5",       "pal6", "pal7", "pal8", "pal9", "pal10",       "pal11", "pal12", "rainbow"     )   )   custom_names <- c("jet", "simspec", "GdRd")   custom_palettes <- list(     oompaBase::jetColors(N = 100),     c(       "#c22b86", "#f769a1", "#fcc5c1", "#253777",       "#1d92c0", "#9ec9e1", "#015b33", "#42aa5e",       "#d9f0a2", "#E66F00", "#f18c28", "#FFBB61"     ),     c("gold", "red3")   )   names(custom_palettes) <- custom_names    palette_list <- list()   all_colors <- c(     rownames(brewer.pal.info),     names(ggsci_db),     rownames(redmonder.pal.info),     rownames(metacartocolors),     names(nord_palettes),     names(viridis_palettes),     ocean_names,     names(dichromat_palettes),     jcolors_names,     custom_names   )   for (pal in all_colors) {     if (!pal %in% all_colors) {       stop(paste0("Invalid pal Must be one of ", paste0(all_colors, collapse = ",")))     }     if (pal %in% rownames(brewer.pal.info)) {       pal_n <- brewer.pal.info[pal, "maxcolors"]       pal_category <- brewer.pal.info[pal, "category"]       if (pal_category == "div") {         palcolor <- rev(brewer.pal(name = pal, n = pal_n))       } else {         if (pal == "Paired") {           palcolor <- brewer.pal(12, "Paired")[c(1:4, 7, 8, 5, 6, 9, 10, 11, 12)]         } else {           palcolor <- brewer.pal(name = pal, n = pal_n)         }       }       if (pal_category == "qual") {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "discrete"       } else {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "continuous"       }     } else if (pal %in% names(ggsci_db)) {       if (pal %in% c("d3", "uchicago", "material")) {         for (subpal in names(ggsci_db[[pal]])) {           palcolor <- ggsci_db[[pal]][[subpal]]           if (pal == "material") {             attr(palcolor, "type") <- "continuous"           } else {             attr(palcolor, "type") <- "discrete"           }           palette_list[[paste0(pal, "-", subpal)]] <- palcolor         }         next       } else {         palcolor <- ggsci_db[[pal]][[1]]         if (pal == "gsea") {           attr(palcolor, "type") <- "continuous"         } else {           attr(palcolor, "type") <- "discrete"         }       }     } else if (pal %in% rownames(redmonder.pal.info)) {       pal_n <- redmonder.pal.info[pal, "maxcolors"]       pal_category <- redmonder.pal.info[pal, "category"]       if (pal_category == "div") {         palcolor <- rev(redmonder.pal(name = pal, n = pal_n))       } else {         palcolor <- redmonder.pal(name = pal, n = pal_n)       }       if (pal_category == "qual") {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "discrete"       } else {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "continuous"       }     } else if (pal %in% rownames(metacartocolors)) {       pal_n <- metacartocolors[pal, "Max_n"]       palcolor <- carto_pal(name = pal, n = pal_n)       if (pal_category == "qualitative") {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "discrete"       } else {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "continuous"       }     } else if (pal %in% names(nord_palettes)) {       palcolor <- nord_palettes[[pal]]       attr(palcolor, "type") <- "discrete"     } else if (pal %in% names(viridis_palettes)) {       palcolor <- viridis_palettes[[pal]]       attr(palcolor, "type") <- "continuous"     } else if (pal %in% names(ocean_palettes)) {       palcolor <- ocean_palettes[[pal]]       attr(palcolor, "type") <- "continuous"     } else if (pal %in% names(dichromat_palettes)) {       palcolor <- dichromat_palettes[[pal]]       if (pal %in% c("Categorical.12", "SteppedSequential.5")) {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "discrete"       } else {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "continuous"       }     } else if (pal %in% jcolors_names) {       palcolor <- jcolors(palette = gsub("jcolors-", "", pal))       if (pal %in% paste0("jcolors-", c("pal10", "pal11", "pal12", "rainbow"))) {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "continuous"       } else {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "discrete"       }     } else if (pal %in% custom_names) {       palcolor <- custom_palettes[[pal]]       if (pal %in% c("jet")) {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "continuous"       } else {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "discrete"       }     }     palette_list[[pal]] <- palcolor   }   # usethis::use_data(palette_list) } } # }

what: Set the panel width/height of a plot to a fixed value — panel_fix
title: Set the panel width/height of a plot to a fixed value — panel_fix
text: ggplot object, stored, can specify height width entire plot, panel. latter obviously important control final result plot. function can set panel width/height plot fixed value rasterize .

title: Set the panel width/height of a plot to a fixed value — panel_fix
code: panel_fix(   x = NULL,   panel_index = NULL,   respect = NULL,   width = NULL,   height = NULL,   margin = 1,   padding = 0,   units = "in",   raster = FALSE,   dpi = 300,   return_grob = FALSE,   bg_color = "white",   save = NULL,   verbose = FALSE,   ... )  panel_fix_overall(   x,   panel_index = NULL,   respect = NULL,   width = NULL,   height = NULL,   margin = 1,   units = "in",   raster = FALSE,   dpi = 300,   return_grob = FALSE,   bg_color = "white",   save = NULL,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Set the panel width/height of a plot to a fixed value — panel_fix
text: x ggplot object, grob object, combined plot made patchwork cowplot package. panel_index Specify panel fixed. NULL, fix panels. respect Whether row heights column widths respect . width desired width fixed panels. height desired height fixed panels. margin margin add around panel, inches. Default 1. padding padding add around panel, inches. Default 0. units units height, width margin given. Can "mm", "cm", "", etc. See grid::unit. raster Whether rasterize panel. dpi Plot resolution. return_grob Whether return grob object instead wrapped patchwork object. Default FALSE. bg_color background color plot. save NULL file name used save plot. verbose Whether print message. Default TRUE. ... Additional arguments passed functions.

title: Set the panel width/height of a plot to a fixed value — panel_fix
code: library(ggplot2) p <- ggplot(   data = mtcars, aes(x = mpg, y = wt, colour = cyl) ) +   geom_point() +   facet_wrap(~gear, nrow = 2) # fix the size of panel panel_fix(   p,   width = 5,   height = 3,   units = "cm" )  # rasterize the panel panel_fix(   p,   width = 5,   height = 3,   units = "cm",   raster = TRUE,   dpi = 90 )   # `panel_fix` will build and render the plot when input a ggplot object. # so after `panel_fix`, the size of the object will be changed. object.size(p) #> 368016 bytes object.size(   panel_fix(     p,     width = 5,     height = 3,     units = "cm"   ) ) #> 1375808 bytes  ## save the plot with appropriate size # p_fix <- panel_fix( #   p, #   width = 5, #   height = 3, #   units = "cm" # ) # plot_size <- attr(p_fix, "size") # ggsave( #   filename = "p_fix.png", #   plot = p_fix, #   units = plot_size$units, #   width = plot_size$width, #   height = plot_size$height # ) ## or save the plot directly # p_fix <- panel_fix( #   p, #   width = 5, #   height = 3, #   units = "cm", #   save = "p_fix.png" # )

what: Shorten and offset the segment — segements_df
title: Shorten and offset the segment — segements_df
text: function takes data frame representing segments plot shortens offsets based provided arguments.

title: Shorten and offset the segment — segements_df
code: segements_df(data, shorten_start, shorten_end, offset)

title: Shorten and offset the segment — segements_df
text: data data frame containing segments. columns 'x', 'y', 'xend', 'yend' representing start end points segment. shorten_start amount shorten start segment . shorten_end amount shorten end segment . offset amount offset segment .

title: Shorten and offset the segment — segements_df
text: modified data frame shortened offset segments.

title: Shorten and offset the segment — segements_df
code: library(ggplot2) temp_nodes <- data.frame(   "x" = c(10, 40),   "y" = c(10, 30) ) data <- data.frame(   "x" = c(10, 40),   "y" = c(10, 30),   "xend" = c(40, 10),   "yend" = c(30, 10) )  ggplot(temp_nodes, aes(x = x, y = y)) +   geom_point(size = 12) +   xlim(0, 50) +   ylim(0, 50) +   geom_segment(     data = data,     aes(x = x, xend = xend, y = y, yend = yend)   )   ggplot(temp_nodes, aes(x = x, y = y)) +   geom_point(size = 12) +   xlim(0, 50) +   ylim(0, 50) +   geom_segment(     data = segements_df(       data,       shorten_start = 2,       shorten_end = 3,       offset = 1     ),     aes(x = x, xend = xend, y = y, yend = yend)   )

title: Show the color palettes — show_palettes
text: function displays color palettes using ggplot2.

title: Show the color palettes — show_palettes
code: show_palettes(   palettes = NULL,   type = c("discrete", "continuous"),   index = NULL,   palette_names = NULL,   return_names = TRUE,   return_palettes = FALSE )

title: Show the color palettes — show_palettes
text: palettes list color palettes. Default NULL. type character vector specifying type palettes include. Default "discrete". index numeric vector specifying indices palettes include. Default NULL. palette_names character vector specifying names palettes include. Default NULL. return_names Whether return names selected palettes. Default TRUE. return_palettes Whether return colors selected palettes. Default FALSE.

title: Show the color palettes — show_palettes
code: show_palettes(   palettes = list(     c("red", "blue", "green"),     c("yellow", "purple", "orange")   ) )  #> [1] "1" "2" all_palettes <- show_palettes(return_palettes = TRUE) "#fcc5c1" "#253777" "#1d92c0" "#9ec9e1" "#015b33" #>  [8] "#42aa5e" "#d9f0a2" "#E66F00" "#f18c28" "#FFBB61" #> attr(,"type") #> [1] "discrete" show_palettes(index = 1:10)  #>  [1] "BrBG"     "PiYG" "Pastel2" "Set1"    "Set2"    #>  [8] "Set3"    "npg"     "aaas"    show_palettes(   type = "continuous",   index = 1:10 )  #>  [1] "BrBG"     "PiYG"     "PRGn"     "PuOr"     "RdBu"     "RdGy"     #>  [7] "RdYlBu"   "RdYlGn"   "Spectral" "Blues"    show_palettes(   palette_names = c(     "Paired", "nejm", "simspec", "Spectral", "jet"   ),   return_palettes = TRUE )  #> $Paired #>  [1] "#A6CEE3" "#1F78B4" "#B2DF8A" "#33A02C" "#FDBF6F" "#FF7F00" "#FB9A99" #>  [8] "#E31A1C" "#CAB2D6" "#6A3D9A" "#FFFF99" "#B15928" #> attr(,"type") #> [1] "discrete" #>  #> $nejm #>      TallPoppy   DeepCerulean "#FFDC91"      "#EE4C97"  #> attr(,"type") #> [1] "discrete" #>  #> $simspec #>  [1] "#c22b86" "#f769a1" "#fcc5c1" "#253777" "#1d92c0" "#9ec9e1" "#015b33" #>  [8] "#42aa5e" "#d9f0a2" "#E66F00" "#f18c28" "#FFBB61" #> attr(,"type") #> [1] "discrete" #>  #> $Spectral #>  [1] "#5E4FA2" "#3288BD" "#66C2A5" "#ABDDA4" "#E6F598" "#FFFFBF" "#FEE08B" #>  [8] "#FDAE61" "#F46D43" "#D53E4F" "#9E0142" #> attr(,"type") #> [1] "continuous" #>  #> $jet #>   [1] "#00007A" "#000085" "#00008F" "#000099" "#0000A3" "#0000AD" "#0000B8" #>   [8] "#0000C2" "#0000CC" "#0000D6" "#0000E0" "#0000EB" "#0000F5" attr(,"type") #> [1] "continuous" #>

what: Slim unused data in the plot — slim_data
title: Slim unused data in the plot — slim_data
text: Remove unused columns data ggplot patchwork object. function keeps columns actually used plot (e.g., mappings, aesthetics, facets), can significantly reduce object size original data contains many unused columns.

title: Slim unused data in the plot — slim_data
code: slim_data(p)  # S3 method for class 'ggplot' slim_data(p)  # S3 method for class 'patchwork' slim_data(p)

title: Slim unused data in the plot — slim_data
text: p ggplot object patchwork object.

title: Slim unused data in the plot — slim_data
text: ggplot patchwork object unused data columns removed.

title: Slim unused data in the plot — slim_data
code: library(ggplot2) p <- ggplot(   data = mtcars,   aes(x = mpg, y = wt, colour = cyl) ) +   geom_point() object.size(p) #> 368016 bytes colnames(p$data) #>  [1] "mpg"  "cyl"  "disp" "hp"   "drat" "wt"   "qsec" "vs"   "am"   "gear" #> [11] "carb"  p_slim <- slim_data(p) #> ℹ [2025-11-10 02:55:09] Vars_used: "mpg", "cyl", and "wt" #> ℹ                       vars_notused: "disp", "hp", "drat", "qsec", "vs", "am", "gear", and "carb" object.size(p_slim) #> 364944 bytes colnames(p_slim$data) #> [1] "mpg" "cyl" "wt"

title: Standardize data by rows — standardise
text: Standardize row data matrix subtracting mean dividing standard deviation.

title: Standardize data by rows — standardise
code: standardise(data)

title: Standardize data by rows — standardise
text: data matrix data frame standardize.

title: Standardize data by rows — standardise
text: standardized data structure input.

title: Blank theme — theme_blank
text: function creates theme elements blank except axis lines labels. can optionally add coordinate axes plot.

title: Blank theme — theme_blank
code: theme_blank(   add_coord = TRUE,   xlen_npc = 0.15,   ylen_npc = 0.15,   xlab = "",   ylab = "",   lab_size = 12,   ... )

title: Blank theme — theme_blank
text: add_coord Whether add coordinate arrows. Default TRUE. xlen_npc length x-axis arrow "npc". ylen_npc length y-axis arrow "npc". xlab label x-axis. ylab label y-axis. lab_size size axis labels. ... Arguments passed ggplot2::theme.

title: Blank theme — theme_blank
code: library(ggplot2) p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg, colour = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point() p + theme_blank()  p + theme_blank(xlab = "x-axis", ylab = "y-axis", lab_size = 16)

what: The default theme for scop plot function. — theme_this
title: The default theme for scop plot function. — theme_this
text: default theme scop plot function.

title: The default theme for scop plot function. — theme_this
code: theme_this(aspect.ratio = NULL, base_size = 12, ...)

title: The default theme for scop plot function. — theme_this
text: aspect.ratio Aspect ratio panel. base_size Base font size ... Arguments passed ggplot2::theme.

title: The default theme for scop plot function. — theme_this
code: library(ggplot2) p <- ggplot(   data = mtcars,   aes(x = wt, y = mpg, colour = factor(cyl)) ) +   geom_point() p + theme_this()

what: Utility Functions for Data Visualization and Plotting — thisplot-package
title: Utility Functions for Data Visualization and Plotting — thisplot-package
text: Provides utility functions data visualization plotting R. Includes functions color manipulation, plot customization, panel size control, data optimization plots, layout adjustments. Designed enhance workflows ggplot2, patchwork, ComplexHeatmap.

title: Utility Functions for Data Visualization and Plotting — thisplot-package
text: https://mengxu98.github.io/thisplot/

title: Utility Functions for Data Visualization and Plotting — thisplot-package
text: Meng Xu (Maintainer), mengxu98@qq.com

title: The logo of thisplot — thisplot_logo
text: thisplot logo, using ASCII Unicode characters Use cli::ansi_strip get rid colors.

title: The logo of thisplot — thisplot_logo
code: thisplot_logo(unicode = cli::is_utf8_output())

title: The logo of thisplot — thisplot_logo
text: unicode Unicode symbols UTF-8 platforms. Default cli::is_utf8_output.

title: The logo of thisplot — thisplot_logo
text: https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyverse/blob/main/R/logo.R

title: The logo of thisplot — thisplot_logo
thisplot 0.1.0
text: initial version
